description: Data was extracted from GDC on March 2020. mRNA expression data was generated using Illumina GA or HiSeq sequencing platforms with information from each of the three files (HTSeq Counts, HTSeq FPKM, HTSeq FPKM-UQ) from the GDC's RNAseq pipeline was combine for each aliquot.

fields.description: Project name abbreviation; the program name appended with a project name abbreviation; eg. TCGA-OV, etc.
fields.name: project_short_name

fields.description: sample barcode, eg TCGA-12-1089-01A. One sample may have multiple sets of CN segmentations corresponding to multiple aliquots; use GROUP BY appropriately in queries
fields.name: sample_barcode

fields.description: Gene name e.g. TTN, DDR1, etc.
fields.name: gene_name

fields.description: The type of genetic element the reads mapped to, eg protein_coding, ribozyme
fields.name: gene_type

fields.description: The Ensembl gene ID from the underlying file, but stripped of the version suffix -- eg ENSG00000185028
fields.name: Ensembl_gene_id

fields.description: The Ensembl gene ID from the underlying file, including the version suffix  --  eg ENSG00000235943.1
fields.name: Ensembl_gene_id_v

fields.description: Number of mapped reads to each gene as calculated by the Python package HTSeq. https://docs.gdc.cancer.gov/Encyclopedia/pages/HTSeq-Counts/
fields.name: HTSeq__Counts

fields.description: FPKM is implemented at the GDC on gene-level read counts that are produced by HTSeq1 and generated using custom. scripts https://docs.gdc.cancer.gov/Encyclopedia/pages/HTSeq-FPKM/
fields.name: HTSeq__FPKM

fields.description: Fragments Per Kilobase of transcript per Million mapped reads (FPKM) is a simple expression level normalization method. The FPKM normalizes read count based on gene length and the total number of mapped reads. https://docs.gdc.cancer.gov/Encyclopedia/pages/HTSeq-FPKM/
fields.name: HTSeq__FPKM_UQ

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for this case (corresponds to the case_barcode).  Can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this:   https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba36
fields.name: case_gdc_id

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for this sample (corresponds to the sample_barcode), eg a1ec9279-c1a6-4e58-97ed-9ec1f36187c5  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal
fields.name: sample_gdc_id

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for this aliquot (corresponds to the aliquot_barcode), eg 7fbfdb3e-1fd2-4206-8d2e-7f68e4a15844  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal
fields.name: aliquot_gdc_id

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for the file containing counts values(corresponds to the file_barcode)  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this: https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba43
fields.name: file_gdc_id_counts

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for the file containing FPKM values (corresponds to the file_barcode)  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this: https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba43
fields.name: file_gdc_id_fpkm

fields.description: Unique GDC identifier for the file containing FPKM UQ values(corresponds to the file_barcode)  --  this can be used to access more information from the GDC data portal like this: https://portal.gdc.cancer.gov/files/c21b332c-06c6-4403-9032-f91c8f407ba43
fields.name: file_gdc_id_fpkm_uq

fields.description: Platform used to generate data; either IlluminaHiSeqor IlluminaGA
fields.name: platform
